message:
The United Kingdom has expressed disappointment over continued confrontational action instead of constructive dialogue between the government and the opposition parties for holding free, fair and credible general elections in Bangladesh.

Robert W Gibson,

 the British high commissioner in Dhaka, in a statement on Saturday said, ‘I am disappointed that we have seen continued confrontational action rather than constructive dialogue between the two main parties that could result in the outcome desired by most ordinary Bangladeshis: free, fair and credible elections in which all parties participate.
name: UK unhappy over political confrontation
